entries.title: Jurgen Klopp: Liverpool manager has no plans to quit 'unless someone tells me'
entries.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he will not leave the club unless he is forced to, and hints at changes at Anfield during the summer.

entries.title: Boris Johnson writing memoir about his time as PM
entries.description: No date has been set for the release of the former prime minister's book, nor does it yet have a title.

entries.title: Everton to review security after threat to directors' safety at Southampton game
entries.description: Everton are reviewing all their security measures after the club's board of directors missed Saturday's game against Southampton because of threats to their safety.

entries.title: Bank of England governor warns of Truss hangover effect
entries.description: The UK still needs to rebuild its economic reputation around the world, says Andrew Bailey.

entries.title: David Carrick: Met investigating 800 officers over abuse claims
entries.description: Sir Mark Rowley apologises for failings in the case of PC David Carrick, who admitted 49 offences.

entries.title: Australian Open 2023: Andy Murray faces tough start against Matteo Berrettini
entries.description: Andy Murray faces a tough start to his Australian Open campaign against Matteo Berrettini as Novak Djokovic makes his return on Tuesday.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Russia's Wagner Group commander requests Norway asylum
entries.description: Andrey Medvedev says he fled Wagner after witnessing war crimes while serving in Ukraine.

entries.title: Ukraine: Military hardware donations weaken Army - UK chief
entries.description: Head of British Army gives backing to plan but raises concerns in internal message seen by the BBC.

entries.title: UK government to block Scottish gender bill
entries.description: It will be the first time ministers in London have used powers to stop a Scottish bill from becoming law.

entries.title: Nurses strike: New dates as union escalates dispute
entries.description: Two days of action - on 6 and 7 February - are announced in England and Wales, in the biggest walkout yet.

entries.title: Owen Farrell: England coach Steve Borthwick stresses captain's important contribution
entries.description: England head coach Steve Borthwick says it is important to recognise how special Owen Farrell is after naming him as captain for the Six Nations.

entries.title: Women's Super League: Sam Kerr and Gabby George feature in best goals
entries.description: Watch the best goals from the latest round of the Women's Super League, including a fine finish from Sam Kerr and an outstanding goal from Gabby George.

entries.title: The green trade row dividing the Davos elite
entries.description: A transatlantic spat over green subsidies is casting a shadow over this year's World Economic Forum.

entries.title: Teachers from NEU union to strike in England and Wales
entries.description: The NEU union announces seven strike days, but says each school will face only four days of disruption.

entries.title: Nepal plane crash: Briton among dozens who died
entries.description: The person was originally named as Irish, but was believed to travelling on a UK passport.

entries.title: Alessia Russo: Fifa Puskas award recognition 'huge' for women's game
entries.description: England striker Alessia Russo says it is "huge" for women's football that her goal is among those to be nominated for the Fifa Puskas award.

entries.title: Ukraine yellow kitchen: Shock at image of apartment wrecked by strike
entries.description: The stark images shows a family kitchen with its external wall ripped off by a Russian missile strike.

entries.title: Euston shooting: Video shows people fleeing after drive-by attack
entries.description: CCTV footage shows the moments after the attack which injured six people outside a church in London.

entries.title: Eddie Jones: 'Australia need former England coach to win back hearts of public'
entries.description: Eddie Jones is the right choice to "win back the hearts and minds of the rugby public" in Australia, says BBC rugby union correspondent Chris Jones.

entries.title: Rwanda asylum policy: Migrants granted right to challenge
entries.description: The High Court has said 11 migrants can take their challenge to the Court of Appeal.

entries.title: Brixton crush: O2 Academy to remain closed, council rules
entries.description: Two people died and several were injured following a crowd surge during a gig in December.

entries.title: Jeremy Clarkson says he apologised to Harry and Meghan over Sun column
entries.description: The TV presenter was criticised for comments he made about the Duchess in a newspaper column.

entries.title: Rishabh Pant: India wicketkeeper says 'road to recovery has begun' after car crash
entries.description: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant says "the road to recovery has begun" after he was involved in a car crash last month.

entries.title: Transgender people lose NHS waiting times High Court case
entries.description: The High Court rules the waiting times faced by four transgender people for treatment were lawful.

entries.title: CCTV shows people fleeing drive-by shooting outside church
entries.description: A man has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after a seven-year-old girl was left seriously injured.

entries.title: Gina Lollobrigida: Italian screen star dies at 95
entries.description: She was a big star in the 1950s and '60s, and her life story was as exotic as the roles she played.

entries.title: Dr Ranj: Four ways to protect your mental health as debt rises
entries.description: The rising cost of living can be stressful but there are steps you can take to help.

entries.title: David Carrick: The serial rapist and abuser in a police uniform
entries.description: Carrick's guilty pleas leave the Metropolitan Police once more apologising for a criminal in its ranks.

entries.title: M&S to create 3,400 jobs as it opens new stores
entries.description: The retailer says it will open 20 stores in the next year, including five in former Debenhams sites.

entries.title: Cost of living: What do I do if I can't afford to pay my debts?
entries.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

entries.title: Gender bill veto would be an outrage - Sturgeon
entries.description: Scotland's first minister says the UK government would be using trans people as a political weapon.

entries.title: Met Police officer David Carrick admits to being serial rapist
entries.description: David Carrick admits 49 offences against 12 victims, including multiple rapes, over two decades.

entries.title: NFL: Sam Hubbard's fumble return for the Cincinnati Bengals features in Sunday's play-off best plays
entries.description: Sam Hubbard's play-off record 98-yard fumble return for the Cincinnati Bengals features in Sunday's NFL wildcard weekend best plays.

entries.title: Love Island: Will social media ban protect islanders?
entries.description: Former islanders and their families talk about the big change to the ITV2 show's new welfare rule.

entries.title: England Six Nations squad: Billy Vunipola, Jonny May & Jack Nowell left out by Steve Borthwick
entries.description: Number eight Billy Vunipola has been left out of new head coach Steve Borthwick's 36-man England squad for the Six Nations.

entries.title: Mykhailo Mudryk: Graham Potter had 'no idea' how Chelsea signed Ukraine winger
entries.description: Chelsea manager Graham Potter says he has "no idea" how the Blues secured the £62m signing of Ukraine winger Mykhailo Mudryk.

entries.title: Australian woman's record-breaking run from continent's 'tip to toe'
entries.description: Erchana Murray-Bartlett has run a marathon a day for 150 days, covering 6,300km (3,900 miles).

entries.title: Scottish teachers begin 16-day wave of rolling strikes
entries.description: The action will affect two councils a day until 6 February, starting with Glasgow and East Lothian.

entries.title: Christine Lambrecht: German defence minister resigns after blunders
entries.description: Christine Lambrecht's exit comes amid pressure to allow the delivery of German-built tanks to Ukraine.

entries.title: Olympic Games to remain free to air on BBC up to 2032
entries.description: Every Olympic Games up to and including the 2032 summer Games will continue to be shown free to air across the BBC.

entries.title: Italy's most-wanted mafia boss Matteo Messina Denaro arrested in Sicily
entries.description: Matteo Messina Denaro, Italy's most-wanted mafia boss, is arrested in Sicily after 30 years on the run.

entries.title: Australian Open: Jack Draper loses to Rafael Nadal at Melbourne Park
entries.description: British rising star Jack Draper tests Spanish great Rafael Nadal before more physical issues lead to a four-set defeat at the Australian Open.

entries.title: The Last of Us: TV series of hit game praised by critics
entries.description: It has been described as "comfortably the best adaptation of a video game ever made" that has been able to "break the curse" on gaming-TV crossovers.

entries.title: Alan Shearer column: Why Arsenal are in control of the Premier League title race
entries.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer says Arsenal will take some shifting from the top of the Premier League but Manchester City and Manchester United are still in the title race.

entries.title: Andrew Tate: Romanian police widen probe into controversial influencer
entries.description: The British-American influencer is in custody over allegations of human trafficking and rape.

entries.title: NHS crisis: The medics trying to fix the health service
entries.description: How doctors are spotting problems early and offering treatments at home - BBC Panorama.

entries.title: Australian Open: Nick Kyrgios withdraws from home Grand Slam
entries.description: Home favourite Nick Kyrgios pulls out of the Australian Open with a knee injury the day before he was scheduled to play his opening match.

entries.title: Molly Russell: Dad criticises social media firms' responses to coroner
entries.description: Social media firms respond to a coroner's call to take action over harmful content.

entries.title: Global firms help Myanmar's military make weapons, says report
entries.description: Troops are using homemade arms against their own people, says a report which urges an end to supplies.

entries.title: Mursal Nabizada: Gunmen kill former Afghan MP at home in Kabul
entries.description: Ms Nabizada was an MP until the government was overthrown by the Taliban in August 2021.

entries.title: Australian Open: Emma Raducanu beats Tamara Korpatsch in Melbourne
entries.description: British number one Emma Raducanu makes a positive return to court after an ankle injury, moving into the Australian Open second round with a straight-set win.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Online school lessons' and 'police powers fury'
entries.description: Papers cover pupils facing online lessons if teachers strike and new police powers to halt protests.

entries.title: Euston shooting: Attempted murder arrest after shooting left girl, 7, seriously injured
entries.description: A man is arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after a shooting injured two girls and four women.

entries.title: Police defend big jump in officers in UK schools
entries.description: Police chiefs say having officers in schools is essential, but campaigners want them all removed.

entries.title: Lab-grown alternatives aim to cut palm oil dependence
entries.description: Two biotech firms have developed oils made from yeast as a replacement for palm.

entries.title: Can humanity's new giant leap into space succeed?
entries.description: Humanity is set for its next big leap into space with nations and private companies racing to build outposts on other worlds

entries.title: Cost of living: The young people saving money by going sober
entries.description: With the price of alcohol going up, young people say they're saving money by going sober.

entries.title: Tottenham players 'aren't enjoying' Conte's tactics, says Danny Murphy
entries.description: Match of the Day 2 pundit Danny Murphy says he "doesn't think Tottenham Hotspur players are enjoying" the way the team is tactically set up following their 2-0 defeat by Arsenal.

entries.title: Energy boss warns higher bills are here to stay
entries.description: Equinor's chief says while prices will not be as volatile, investment in renewables must be paid for.

entries.title: Cost of living: Charity warns Christmas debt could take years to repay
entries.description: Advisers warn of pain to come as a poll for the BBC suggests many have no idea how they will repay festive spending.
